     14 // Mapping from known file extensions to filetype hinting.
     15 var filenameToLangMap map[string]string = map[string]string{
     16 	"BUILD":       "python",
     17 	"BUILD.bazel": "python",
     18 	"WORKSPACE":   "python",
     19 }
     20 var extToLangMap map[string]string = map[string]string{
     21 	".AppleScript": "applescript",
     22 	".bzl":         "python",
     23 	".c":           "c",
     24 	".coffee":      "coffeescript",
     25 	".cpp":         "cpp",
     26 	".css":         "css",
     27 	".go":          "go",
     28 	".h":           "cpp",
     29 	".hs":          "haskell",
     30 	".html":        "markup",
     31 	".java":        "java",
     32 	".js":          "javascript",
     33 	".json":        "json",
     34 	".jsx":         "jsx",
     35 	".m":           "objectivec",
     36 	".markdown":    "markdown",
     37 	".md":          "markdown",
     38 	".nix":         "nix",
     39 	".php":         "php",
     40 	".pl":          "perl",
     41 	".proto":       "go",
     42 	".py":          "python",
     43 	".pyst":        "python",
     44 	".rb":          "ruby",
     45 	".rs":          "rust",
     46 	".scala":       "scala",
     47 	".scpt":        "applescript",
     48 	".scss":        "scss",
     49 	".sh":          "bash",
     50 	".sky":         "python",
     51 	".sql":         "sql",
     52 	".swift":       "swift",
     53 	".tsx":         "tsx",
     54 	".xml":         "markup",
     55 	".yaml":        "yaml",
     56 	".yml":         "yaml",
     57 }
     58 
     59 type breadCrumbEntry struct {
     60 	Name string
     61 	Path string
     62 }
     63 
     64 type directoryListEntry struct {
     65 	Name          string
     66 	Path          string
     67 	IsDir         bool
     68 	SymlinkTarget string
     69 }
     70 
     71 type fileViewerContext struct {
     72 	PathSegments   []breadCrumbEntry
     73 	Repo           config.RepoConfig
     74 	Commit         string
     75 	DirContent     *directoryContent
     76 	FileContent    *sourceFileContent
     77 	ExternalDomain string
     78 	Permalink      string
     79 	Headlink       string
     80 }
     81 
     82 type sourceFileContent struct {
     83 	Content   string
     84 	LineCount int
     85 	Language  string
     86 }
     87 
     88 type directoryContent struct {
     89 	Entries []directoryListEntry
     90 }
     91 
     92 type DirListingSort []directoryListEntry
     93 
     94 func (s DirListingSort) Len() int {
     95 	return len(s)
     96 }
     97 
     98 func (s DirListingSort) Swap(i, j int) {
     99 	s[i], s[j] = s[j], s[i]
    100 }
    101 
    102 func (s DirListingSort) Less(i, j int) bool {
    103 	if s[i].IsDir != s[j].IsDir {
    104 		return s[i].IsDir
    105 	}
    106 	return s[i].Name < s[j].Name
    107 }
    108 
    109 func gitCommitHash(ref string, repoPath string) (string, error) {
    110 	out, err := exec.Command(
    111 		"git", "-C", repoPath, "rev-parse", ref,
    112 	).Output()
    113 	if err != nil {
    114 		return "", err
    115 	}
    116 	return string(out), nil
    117 }
    118 
    119 func gitObjectType(obj string, repoPath string) (string, error) {
    120 	out, err := exec.Command("git", "-C", repoPath, "cat-file", "-t", obj).Output()
    121 	if err != nil {
    122 		return "", err
    123 	}
    124 	return strings.TrimSpace(string(out)), nil
    125 }
    126 
    127 func gitCatBlob(obj string, repoPath string) (string, error) {
    128 	out, err := exec.Command("git", "-C", repoPath, "cat-file", "blob", obj).Output()
    129 	if err != nil {
    130 		return "", err
    131 	}
    132 	return string(out), nil
    133 }
    134 
    135 type gitTreeEntry struct {
    136 	Mode       string
    137 	ObjectType string
    138 	ObjectId   string
    139 	ObjectName string
    140 }
    141 
    142 func gitParseTreeEntry(line string) gitTreeEntry {
    143 	dataAndPath := strings.SplitN(line, "\t", 2)
    144 	dataFields := strings.Split(dataAndPath[0], " ")
    145 	return gitTreeEntry{
    146 		Mode:       dataFields[0],
    147 		ObjectType: dataFields[1],
    148 		ObjectId:   dataFields[2],
    149 		ObjectName: dataAndPath[1],
    150 	}
    151 }
    152 
    153 func gitListDir(obj string, repoPath string) ([]gitTreeEntry, error) {
    154 	out, err := exec.Command("git", "-C", repoPath, "cat-file", "-p", obj).Output()
    155 	if err != nil {
    156 		return nil, err
    157 	}
    158 
    159 	lines := strings.Split(string(out), "\n")
    160 	lines = lines[:len(lines)-1]
    161 	result := make([]gitTreeEntry, len(lines))
    162 	for i, line := range lines {
    163 		result[i] = gitParseTreeEntry(line)
    164 	}
    165 	return result, nil
    166 }
    167 
    168 func viewUrl(repo string, path string) string {
    169 	return "/view/" + repo + "/" + path
    170 }
    171 
    172 func getFileUrl(repo string, pathFromRoot string, name string, isDir bool) string {
    173 	fileUrl := viewUrl(repo, filepath.Join(pathFromRoot, path.Clean(name)))
    174 	if isDir {
    175 		fileUrl += "/"
    176 	}
    177 	return fileUrl
    178 }
    179 
    180 func buildDirectoryListEntry(treeEntry gitTreeEntry, pathFromRoot string, repo config.RepoConfig) directoryListEntry {
    181 	var fileUrl string
    182 	var symlinkTarget string
    183 	if treeEntry.Mode == "120000" {
    184 		resolvedPath, err := gitCatBlob(treeEntry.ObjectId, repo.Path)
    185 		if err == nil {
    186 			symlinkTarget = resolvedPath
    187 		}
    188 	} else {
    189 		fileUrl = getFileUrl(repo.Name, pathFromRoot, treeEntry.ObjectName, treeEntry.ObjectType == "tree")
    190 	}
    191 	return directoryListEntry{
    192 		Name:          treeEntry.ObjectName,
    193 		Path:          fileUrl,
    194 		IsDir:         treeEntry.ObjectType == "tree",
    195 		SymlinkTarget: symlinkTarget,
    196 	}
    197 }
    198 
    199 func buildFileData(relativePath string, repo config.RepoConfig, commit string) (*fileViewerContext, error) {
    200 	commitHash := commit
    201 	out, err := gitCommitHash(commit, repo.Path)
    202 	if err == nil {
    203 		commitHash = out[:strings.Index(out, "\n")]
    204 	}
    205 	cleanPath := path.Clean(relativePath)
    206 	if cleanPath == "." {
    207 		cleanPath = ""
    208 	}
    209 	obj := commitHash + ":" + cleanPath
    210 	pathSplits := strings.Split(cleanPath, "/")
    211 
    212 	var fileContent *sourceFileContent
    213 	var dirContent *directoryContent
    214 
    215 	objectType, err := gitObjectType(obj, repo.Path)
    216 	if err != nil {
    217 		return nil, err
    218 	}
    219 	if objectType == "tree" {
    220 		treeEntries, err := gitListDir(obj, repo.Path)
    221 		if err != nil {
    222 			return nil, err
    223 		}
    224 		dirEntries := make([]directoryListEntry, len(treeEntries))
    225 		for i, treeEntry := range treeEntries {
    226 			dirEntries[i] = buildDirectoryListEntry(treeEntry, cleanPath, repo)
    227 		}
    228 		sort.Sort(DirListingSort(dirEntries))
    229 		dirContent = &directoryContent{
    230 			Entries: dirEntries,
    231 		}
    232 	} else if objectType == "blob" {
    233 		content, err := gitCatBlob(obj, repo.Path)
    234 		if err != nil {
    235 			return nil, err
    236 		}
    237 		language := filenameToLangMap[filepath.Base(cleanPath)]
    238 		if language == "" {
    239 			language = extToLangMap[filepath.Ext(cleanPath)]
    240 		}
    241 		fileContent = &sourceFileContent{
    242 			Content:   content,
    243 			LineCount: strings.Count(string(content), "\n"),
    244 			Language:  language,
    245 		}
    246 	}
    247 
    248 	segments := make([]breadCrumbEntry, len(pathSplits))
    249 	for i, name := range pathSplits {
    250 		parentPath := path.Clean(strings.Join(pathSplits[0:i], "/"))
    251 		segments[i] = breadCrumbEntry{
    252 			Name: name,
    253 			Path: getFileUrl(repo.Name, parentPath, name, true),
    254 		}
    255 	}
    256 
    257 	externalDomain := "external viewer"
    258 	if url, err := url.Parse(repo.Metadata["url_pattern"]); err == nil {
    259 		externalDomain = url.Hostname()
    260 	}
    261 
    262 	permalink := ""
    263 	headlink := ""
    264 	if !strings.HasPrefix(commitHash, commit) {
    265 		permalink = "?commit=" + commitHash[:16]
    266 	} else {
    267 		if dirContent != nil {
    268 			headlink = "."
    269 		} else {
    270 			headlink = segments[len(segments)-1].Name
    271 		}
    272 	}
    273 
    274 	return &fileViewerContext{
    275 		PathSegments:   segments,
    276 		Repo:           repo,
    277 		Commit:         commit,
    278 		DirContent:     dirContent,
    279 		FileContent:    fileContent,
    280 		ExternalDomain: externalDomain,
    281 		Permalink:      permalink,
    282 		Headlink:       headlink,
    283 	}, nil
    284 }
